node.title: Children's Commissioner says occupation bound to have impact on kids
node.description: Children's Commissioner Judge Frances Eivers says the anti-mandate protest on Parliament grounds is no place for children who could be harmed in escalating tension. Audio

node.title: Christchurch mayor to mark earthquake anniversary with video message
node.description: At nine-minutes to 1PM today, it will be 11 years since a devastating earthquake struck Canterbury, killing 185 people.

node.title: Ukraine's separatist regions: What you need to know
node.description: Putin recognized the independence of Moscow-backed rebel regions in eastern Ukraine, a move that will further inflame tensions with the West.

node.title: Super Rugby Aupiki on the move
node.description: Condensed inaugural Super Rugby Aupiki competition to kick off in Taupo bubble.

node.title: Ukraine tensions: Biden agrees in principle to summit with Putin
node.description: US President Joe Biden has agreed "in principle" to hold a summit with Russian President Vladimir Putin to discuss the crisis over Ukraine.

node.title: Hundreds to miss out on procedures as two hospitals cut back on services
node.description: The decision was made at a high-level meeting yesterday, with the situation expected to continue for four weeks at two Auckland hospitals. Audio

node.title: Ardern says easing of restrictions to begin 'well beyond' Omicron peak
node.description: Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern says the Omicron outbreak is likely to peak in three to six weeks. At that point, she says, the country will move down the traffic light settings, easing off gatheringâ€¦

node.title: Plan to easing restrictions 'sensible', 'pragmatic', experts say
node.description: Covid-19 experts are backing the government's approach to easing restrictions, once Omicron cases passes its peak. Audio

node.title: Big banks' economists predict 25 basis points rise to OCR
node.description: The Reserve Bank releases its first monetary policy statement this week and the only issue is not if it raises the official cash rate (OCR), but by how much.

node.title: Mentorship for women aims to broaden horizons in start-up sector
node.description: Women will have access to some of the country's leading venture capital firms during a new 12-week programme.

node.title: Financial support relieves hospitality, but future uncertainty remains
node.description: Decimated after two years of Covid-19 restrictions, the hospitality sector describes the latest financial support being offered by the government as encouraging but too late for some to survive.

node.title: Freight and logistics company Move reports half-year loss
node.description: The company said its financial result reflected the impact of the lockdown and regional border restrictions that were introduced in response to the outbreak of the Delta variant.

node.title: Dimetrius Pairama's murderers to appeal convictions and sentences
node.description: Two people who kidnapped, tortured and hanged a 17-year-old will begin to appeal their convictions and prison sentences today.

node.title: Coroner declines to stand down at coronial inquiry into terror attacks
node.description: A hearing into the scope of the coronial inquiry into the Christchurch mosque attacks will proceed, after the coroner declined to stand aside on the grounds of apparent bias.

node.title: Officer says George Floyd "didn't look good" after he was turned face-up
node.description: Thomas Lane, 38, said that was the first time he had seen Floyd's face since police had put the 46-year-old Black man on the ground while struggling to arrest him.

node.title: U.S. to impose sanctions after Putin recognizes breakaway Ukraine regions
node.description: White House press secretary Jen Psaki said the penalties are "separate from and would be in addition to the swift and severe economic measures" the U.S. has been preparing with allies.

node.title: Moana Pasifika readying for return to play
node.description: Moana Pasifika say they're doing everything they can to play their opening Super Rugby Pacific match this weekend.

node.title: Capitol rioter gets lighter sentence for cooperating with January 6 committee
node.description: The leniency could send a message in future sentencing hearings for other January 6 defendants.

node.title: Isolation rules 'extremely challenging' for non-critical workforce
node.description: Business reps and high profile doctors are agreeing that shorter isolation periods are needed to keep businesses running as the Omicron outbreak picks up speed.

node.title: New financial supports for Covid-19 announced
node.description: Targeted payments to businesses strugging in the red traffic light, an interest-free extension to small business loans, and flexibility on tax payment dates are being offered by the government.

node.title: Medina Spirit stripped of 2021 Kentucky Derby title for positive drug test
node.description: The news comes more than two months after Medina Spirit collapsed and died following a workout at Santa Anita.

node.title: Michigan deacon's mistake renders hundreds of baptisms invalid
node.description: The Archdiocese of Detroit still hasn't heard from hundreds of people whose rites at St. Anastasia are considered invalid, despite outreach efforts and publicity.

node.title: Putin says he'll recognize independence of Ukraine breakaway regions
node.description: The U.S. warned last week that such a move would violate international law and would "necessitate a swift and firm response" from America and its allies.

node.title: "Tinder Swindler" accuser speaks out against alleged con man
node.description: Cecilie Fjellhoy is one of three women whose stories are told in the hit Netflix documentary "Tinder Swindler." All three say they met Shimon Hayut on Tinder and were conned by him.

node.title: Dog missing for 12 years is reunited with family
node.description: "Honestly, I'm in shock. I definitely didn't expect this to ever happen, so I'm really excited. Excited to hopefully bring her back, get her healthy and live the rest of her life," Zoey's owner said.

node.title: Homeowners wrestle with unsettled quake claims 11 years on
node.description: On the 11th anniversary of the Christchurch earthquake, a lawyer dealing with outstanding insurance claims says the city still has a long way to go.

node.title: Paul Farmer, global health care pioneer, dies at 62
node.description: Samantha Power, the former U.S. ambassador to the United Nations, tweeted that Farmer was "a giant" in his field.

node.title: 'Going to be disruptive': Lab worker tests positive to Covid-19
node.description: New Zealand Institute of Medical Laboratory Science president Terry Taylor says while the absence of one from the team will affect capacity, colleagues will fill in the gaps as best they could.

node.title: Queen tests positive for Covid-19
node.description: The Queen has tested positive for Covid but has mild symptoms and expects to continue "light duties" at Windsor, Buckingham Palace says.

node.title: South Auckland church steps up for at-risk families struggling to self-isolate
node.description: With cases of Omicron accelerating at an alarming rate, one South Auckland reverend is calling on fellow ministers to put their hands up to help those needing to self-isolate.
